fields.description:
h3. Summary

Add-on pages are not fully rendered on Safari.
h3. Environment

Verified versions:
 * The Universal Plugin Manager v1001.0.75.D20180117T223352
 * Safari Version 11.0.3 (13604.5.6)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use Safari
 # Open "Find new add-ons" "Manage add-ons"
 # Confirm pages are missing their expected contents

h3. Expected Results

Add-on pages are properly rendered.
h3. Actual Results

The page doesn't contain any expected add-on list.

!Screenshot 2018-02-05 16.45.09.png|thumbnail! !Screenshot 2018-02-05 16.45.21.png|thumbnail!

Console complains the following errors:
{code:none}
[Error] Error: A component definition of type "c" with the ID of "aui-dropdown2-trigger" already exists.
	set (aui.min.js:2:6991)
	l (aui.min.js:2:17594)
	(anonymous function) (aui.min.js:4:15063)
	Global Code (aui.min.js:4:22522)

[Error] ReferenceError: Can't find variable: __1a99a68c34e660050a094f87fb28903d
	(anonymous function) (aui-experimental.min.js:3:6807)
	Global Code (aui-experimental.min.js:3:8651)

[Error] Failed to load resource: The operation couldn’t be completed. Protocol error
{code}
h3. Notes
 * Occasionally (say 1 in 10), the pages are properly rendered. So this might depends on resource loading timing, etc.
 * This happens to Jira Cloud as well

h3. Workaround

Use another browser such as Google Chrome.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a document is opened with the Atlassian Companion, it will work correctly for the first time. If the document is saved, it will upload correctly to Confluence, but if clicked to edit it again with Atlassian Companion, the document open will be the old (unedited) version.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud;
 * Atlassian Companion (latest version);
 ( Tested with windows 7, internet explorer and office )

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Open any document using the Atlassian Companion (Edit with menu);
 * Edit the document on the computer and save;
 * Update on Confluence;
 * Click to Edith with again.

h3. Expected Results

The document opened should be the new version.
h3. Actual Results

The document opened is the old unedited version.
h3. Workaround

Download the file, edit directly with preferred software on the computer and upload it again to Confluence.
fields.summary: Wrong document version opened with Atlassian Companion

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On an Overview page of Confluence, when you click on a link, sometimes:
- it keeps on Overview page, but the left sidebar opens the index;
- nothing happens;
- it redirects to the correct page.

Also, when clicking on the browser back button after, sometimes an error message is shown: Page Not Found.


h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* On Confluence Cloud, add to the Overview page of a Space links to some pages of the Space.
* 1. Click on a link on the Overview page. 
* 2. Also, after the step above, click the back button of the browser.


h3. Expected Results
* 1. When you click on a link, the correct page opens.
* 2. When you click on the browser back button after, you go back to the previous page.


h3. Actual Results
* 1. Clicking a page link:
* Sometimes it keeps on Overview page, but the left sidebar opens the index;
* Sometimes nothing happens.

* 2. Second part, clicking the browser back button:
* Sometimes it appears an error message: Page Not Found.


h3.Workaround
* None yet.
fields.summary: Links and back button on Overview not working or pointing to wrong pages

fields.description:
h3. Summary

[The Share on Confluence Bookmarklet | https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/shared-links-blueprint-937893685.html] is used to share web pages as confluence pages.When the bookmarklet is clicked. it opens a new window in which it allows you to select the space you want to share to, add comments:

!Screen Shot 2018-02-01 at 4.01.29 PM.png|thumbnail!  

The Bookmarklet makes a REST API call to check if the user has permission to publish content and the call contains a reference to the user's personal space, as that is the first suggestion in list of selectable spaces. 

e.g. https://INSTANCENAMEREDACTED.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/sharelinks/1.0/can-create-comment?spaceKey=~admin

This API call fails if the user who is trying to publish does not have a personal space. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user on an instance, and make sure the user does not have a personal space.
# Add the Share on Confluence Bookmarklet to the browser.
# Attempt to share something via the bookmarklet

 
h3. Expected Results
Share a Link menu pops up and user can create a page.
 
h3. Actual Results

Following error is encountered
 !Screen Shot 2018-02-01 at 4.11.02 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Workaround

Make sure that user has a personal space.
fields.summary: Share on Confluence Bookmarklet does not work unless you have a personal space on the instance

fields.description:
h3. Summary

* When dragging and dropping or copying and pasting an image from external services to a Confluence page, Confluence won't convert the image to a .jpg file. If a user other than the user who pasted the image tries to see the image, it won't be possible because a link was pasted into the page, not an image created, causing a 403 error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Drag and drop an image from an external service, such as Gmail, to a Confluence page.

h3. Expected Results
* Confluence will convert the image into a .jpg file and list it as an attachment to the page.

h3. Actual Results
* Confluence pastes a copied image into a page. Users other than the user who added this copied image won't be able to see it.
* If the image is hosted in a dangerous site (as categorized by Google Chrome, or any other web browser) the whole Confluence page might not load.

h3.Workaround
* Save the image and upload it into Confluence.
fields.summary: Confluence doesn't convert images dragged and dropped or copied and pasted from external services

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a user that has username with @ (e.g. user@email.com) clicks on Overview on a Personal Space, the URL has '%40' instead of '@'  and doesn't work. 
Example: https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/~user%40email.com/overview.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Go to the Personal Space of a user with username that has @ (e.g. user@email.com). 
* Click on Overview.

h3. Expected Results
* User is directed to the Overview page: https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/~user@email.com/overview

h3. Actual Results
* User is directed to a 404 error page with the message: 
Oops, you've found a dead link
Go back to the previous page
Go to the home page
* The link to the page shows as: https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/~user%40email.com/overview.


h3.Workaround
* Change the '%40' manually to '@'.
fields.summary: Personal Space Overview link generates wrong URL when username has @

fields.description:
Currently, when copying a page between spaces, you need to specify the new space as well as the parent page in that new space. If the parent page is left empty, the page will be moved to the space, but will become orphaned. The expectation is that you enter the space's home page in the field if you want it to be a first level page, as all such pages have the home page as a "parent".

Some users find this requirement unintuitive, and would prefer it that when the parent page field is left empty, the page be made a first level page.
fields.summary: Specifying no parent page during page copy should automatically make the page a first-level page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence complains 404 not found error if the space key contains at least 1 URI reserved characters.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login as a user whose username contains URI reserved characters such as {{sample.username@example.com}}
# Create a Personal Space
# Confirm the created space shows 404 error

h3. Expected Results

Able to access the space.

h3. Actual Results

Unable to access the space due to 404 error.

h3. Notes

- [RFC 3986: URI reserved Characters|https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986]
{code:none}
!	*	'	(	)	;	:	@	&	=	+	$	,	/	?	#	[	]
{code}



h3.Workaround
* (Temporal) Directly access non-percent-encoded URL. For example:
** (x) {{/wiki/spaces/~sample.username%40example.com/overview}}
** (/) {{/wiki/spaces/~sample.username@example.com/overview}}
* (Permanent) Contact https://support.atlassian.com/contact/
fields.summary: Space key containing URI Reserved Characters causes 404 Error

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Many Cloud users are requesting that we have some sort of restricted view for anonymous users, for example that does not include the sidebar, Space Tools (See CONFCLOUD-55260), Search, Activity, Spaces list etc. 

Users have also suggested hiding the login option, although I don't know how feasible this would be since it would require providing anonymous users with a separate URL than the one that regular users are given to access Confluence.

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a "Public User" view that would hide more of these features as not to confuse anonymous users that just need to read the content on the Confluence site.
fields.summary: Improved view for public (anonymous) users

fields.description:
I am trying to add a Created vs Resolved chart in confluence page but the macro does not allow me to choose all the filters from Jira

Randomly I find few of the filters.

Jira Version JDC 7.2.6

Confluence 6.2.3
fields.summary: Confluence is fetching filters from the JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Summary:  HTML encoding issues when using Italian Version of Confluence

 Steps to Reproduce: 
 # Change the Confluence Language to Italian.
 # Click the menu for Look and Feel

h3. Expected Results

Characters should be displayed in Italian.
h3. Actual Results

Screenshots displaying the bug is attached below.
Accented Letters are not displayed properly.
fields.summary: HTML Encoding Issues with Italian

fields.description:
h3. Problem
- Taking a look at the page below created by Atlassian, we can see two attachments being displayed inside boxes with the possibility to download it directly by clicking.

- https://atlassian.design/guidelines/marketing/resources/presentation-kit/

h3. Suggestion
- Allow images to have a URL link

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Allow to place links on images

fields.description:
h3. Problem
In Confluence, we don't have an option to not send notifications to watchers for new pages created like when we are editing a page.

h3. Suggestion
Add an option to not send a notification to watchers when creating new pages.

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Option to not send notification for new pages created

fields.description:
h3. The issue

Whenever you access the *Overview* page for a given space, there is a popup stating that "Something went wrong". After looking onto the console logs for the browser, the following exception is thrown:
 !Screen Shot 2018-01-29 at 16.38.13.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Replicate
 # Go to a space
 # Access the *Overview* page
 # Edit the page
 # Insert a Content Report Table with label which has space in it. E.g. "Bad label"
 # Save the macro
 # Save the page

h3. Expected behavior

The page loads nicely
h3. Actual behavior

The page never finishes loading, and the popup appears on the screen.
fields.summary: Space overview page fails to load

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently there's no way to hide sidebar from anonymous users and JIRA Service Desk customer.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide an option to hide sidebar from anonymous users and JIRA Service Desk customer.
h3. Workaround
 * None. There used to be well-known workaround for this use case like answers below, however, after SPA is enabled, Confluence no longer supports style macro. See also ---CONFCLOUD-57189---.
 ** [Solved: How to hide the "spaces"-Button in Confluence Clou... |https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/How-to-hide-the-quot-spaces-quot-Button-in-Confluence-Cloud/qaq-p/308563]
 ** [How to hide the "space tools" menu from anonymous ... |https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Questions-for-Confluence/How-to-hide-the-quot-space-tools-quot-menu-from-anonymous-users/qaq-p/5084]
fields.summary: Ability to hide sidebar from users from anonymous users

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you add or change the heading of a sentence it will change the structure of the entire paragraph when using two even columns sections.

h3. Environment
(!) Confluence 1000.0.0-f3773b37dfe

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a section with two even columns
# Inside one of the columns add some lines of text
# Change the heading of the top sentence to heading 1
# Revert the same sentence clicking on heading 1 again
# With the same sentence highlighted choose heading 1 again, it will change the structure of the entire paragraph

h3. Expected Results
It should apply the heading only to the highlighted text

h3. Actual Results
It applies the heading to the entire paragraph
 
h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Headings change the paragraph structure with two even columns sections

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Request access (Request sent) message displays HTML code instead of user name, as shown on the attached image.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Try to access a restricted page that you don't have permission;
# Click on the Request access button.

h3. Expected Results
The message shown displays the owner name.

h3. Actual Results
The message shown displays the HTML code corresponding to the owner name.

h3. Notes
The request is sent normally.

h3.Workaround
No need for a workaround, since this is a aesthetic bug and the request is sent correctly.
fields.summary: Request access (Request sent) message displays HTML code instead of user name

fields.description:
In Confluence, one of the bundled macros would be the [User Profile Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/user-profile-macro-724765307.html] in which the user can display the names and pictures for people's profile. However, this macro only allows a username to be inserted so the picture/name will be displayed on the page.

As for this request, it would be awesome if the macro had additional parameters to be applied to how it will be displayed. Specifically, being able to:

* Increase the Picture size - So the user can better see the members or adjust it to fit better with the page
* Make the pictures clickable so we could be redirected to the user profile and get more information from the member
fields.summary: Additional Configuration for User Profile Macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The links from the Recently viewed pages dialog are not working.
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # From anywhere on Confluence press g and r to open the Recently viewed pages dialog.
 # Click on any page title on the dialog.

h3. Expected Results

The page should open.
h3. Actual Results

The page won't open.
h3. Workaround

Use the *Recently visited* page under Sidebar -> Your work -> Recently visited.
fields.summary: Recently viewed pages dialog's links are not working

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In the Getting Started with Confluence Cloud, the documentation is more words than images, which can cause users to miss certain aspects.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/get-started-with-confluence-cloud/

For example, the sidebar:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/get-started-with-confluence-cloud/the-sidebar-934720158.html

The images in a lot of the documentation are mostly just graphics and mock-ups. But if someone wants to know how to add things to the sidebar, there's nothing here that shows that you have to mouse-over on the corner and that a pencil icon will appear, there's not even a pencil icon image on the documentation to show what it will look like.

h3. Suggested Solution

I think if we include more visual representations of what everything will look like, it will be helpful for users to go straight to the part they need without having to contact support.
fields.summary: Update Getting Started with Confluence Cloud documentation to be more clear with more images

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently it's not possible to search contents of attachments limited to the current page.
If you attempt to restrict to parent of current page for attachments only, it doesn't find anything.
Additionally, full search moves away from current page so it's not evident to users if parent of "current page" option in full search is working

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a search option to restrict search to the current page, which will also help users if they tend to store a lot of documents in Confluence.
fields.summary: Ability to search contents of attachments for current page

fields.description:
h3. Problem
- Taking a look on the page below created by Atlassian, we can see two attachments being displayed inside boxes with the possibility to download it. Also these boxes have title, effect when hovering the mouse and a thumbnail.

An example would be this page:
- https://atlassian.design/guidelines/marketing/resources/presentation-kit/

h3. Suggestion
- Allow to use the same elements in Confluence Cloud, since due to the restricted CSS/HTML features it's not possible to customise it.

h3. Workaround.
- None
fields.summary: Add new CSS/HTML elements for attachments

fields.description:
Option to undo and redo after a manual page reorder on Confluence Cloud.

Steps: 
Choose a Space > Space Tools > Content Tools > Reorder Pages > drag and drop a page on another order > be able to undo and redo the action.
fields.summary: Undo and redo for reorder pages

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Creating meeting notes page results in the following message error: 
No PageTemplate found for ContentTemplateRef: 524406:com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-business-blueprints:meeting-notes-page

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Navigate to a meeting notes page. 
* Click the Create meeting note button. 
* On Let's get started box, click Create. 

Alternatively:
* Navigate to a meeting notes page. 
* Click the + icon.  
* On Create box, click on Meeting notes. 
* Click on Create. 

h3. Expected Results
* A new meeting notes page is created.

h3. Actual Results
* An error message is shown:  
No PageTemplate found for ContentTemplateRef: 524406:com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-business-blueprints:meeting-notes-page

h3. Workaround
* None yet.
fields.summary: Error creating meeting notes page

fields.description: Currently, the Expand Macro title is a static text, functioning similarly to a heading. A number of users have expressed the desire to have this text to be dynamic (eg. showing Click to Expand when closed and Click to Collapse when open)
fields.summary: Allow option for Reactive/Dynamic text in Expand Macro Title

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
A sprint burndown report takes longer to load in Confluence than in Jira

h3. Suggested Solution
Improve the performance of the integration of Jira and Confluence
fields.summary: Improve the performance of the Sprint Burndown report

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When creating Jira issues from highlighted text on a page, the Jira issue will be created but will not be linked on the page. Instead, an error is displayed.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use an instance with an application link between Confluence and Jira
# Create a page with text
# Highlight some text
# Create a Jira issue


h3. Expected Results
Confluence will successfully create Jira issues and add them as Jira Issue Macro elements to the page

h3. Actual Results
Intermittently, Confluence will create the Jira issue but fail to add the Jira Issue Macro element to the page.
 
h3. Notes
* This occurs even when Confluence page was refreshed in a short period of time.
fields.summary: Creating Jira Issues from highlight fails to update the page and shows a 'These can't be added to the page because you were viewing an outdated version of this page'

fields.description:
*Summary*

According to General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), which will go into effect May 25, 2018, companies have to make sure that all information affiliated with users that are no longer working in the company will be anonymized and/or deleted.

 

*Actual Results*

Deleted users are visible in the application as Unknown User (username), if the username was the user email address, then, in brackets, we will still be able to see its email address even if that user was deleted.

 

*Expected Results*

Deleted users name should be only Unknown User.

 

*Steps to Reproduce* 
 # Delete a user
 # All content is mapped to Unknown User (username)

 

 

*Notes*

 

*Workaround*

Map the content to another user (e.g. anonymous).
fields.summary: GDPR requirements: Unknown User (username) format for deleted user

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After performing a site import, the TinyURLs are not updated and therefore are still pointing to the source destination.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use TinyURL in your pages
# Generate a backup of Confluence.
# Import it to a new Cloud instance.
# Check the pages which display TinyURL.

h3. Expected Results
The TinyURL is updated correctly after import.

h3. Actual Results
The TinyURL stays the same and cannot be used as it points to the original location.
 
h3.Workaround
The only way to fix these TinyURL is to manually go through each one and change it to the correct TinyURL displayed in the *Page information*.
fields.summary: TinyURL are not updated after import to another Cloud instance

fields.description:

 # Try to edit any page
 # Notice that pre Collaborative Editor is loading forever and the page cannot be edited.

There is a white screen and an circle-waiting-icon.

fields.summary: Cannot edit pages

fields.description:
h3. Summary

*Images added from clipboard* appear broken after publishing / saving the page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit a page in Confluence.
 # Copy an image to clipboard using Mac OS screenshot feature. 
 # Paste an image using Cmd+V.
 # Observe an image added to the page.
 # Publish changes.

h3. Expected Results

Pasted images should be saved correctly.
h3. Actual Results

Pasted images always show as broken.
h3. Notes

Browser: Safari

Instance: Pug, Fabric
fields.summary: Pasted images are broken

fields.description:
h3.The problem
When copying a page, and changing its location in Edit mode, the order is not respected in the destination space. 

h3.Steps to replicate
# Create a new page and Publish it
# Click on *Ellipsis (...) > Copy*
# Once in *Edit Mode* of the copied page click on the *Location button* next to the Page address on top of the title
# Under *Advanced*, choose the destination space and parent page
# Right next to the *Move* button, check the *Reorder* check-box
# Put the page below or above any page on the space
# Click *Reorder*

h3.Expected Behavior
Once you access the space, the page will be displayed right where you chose to on the Page Tree

h3.Actual Behavior
The page is sent to the bottom of the Page Tree
fields.summary: Reorder page during Copy not working as it should

fields.description:
In Confluence, when you are working with tables inside a page, when selecting the whole table to be aligned (center, left or right) the cursor will not indicate that the table is being highlighted, which makes the operation toilsome for the users to be sure that a table is correctly highlighted so the alignment can take effect. 

For example, since there is no indication of the rows/cells highlighted, if you do not select it all, the alignment will not work and will not be applied to the table. This is a suggestion to either:

* Allow the table to be aligned without highlight all its content (only clicking on the beginning of the table)
* Provide an option to make sure that all the table content is highlighted, so it can be aligned in a simple method.
fields.summary: Simple Method to Highlight and Center Tables in Confluence

fields.description:
I've been testing a group of user management related events as part of my ISO27k work. I noticed that the {{UserRemoveEvent}} never actually gets called during a user sync with identity, and as a result, there's a bunch of stuff in the {{UserPreRemovalCleanupListener}} that never executes. This is DB cleanup stuff relating to permissions, notifications, relations etc. Because there's no foreign key relationship between these and the deleted Confluence backing user, nothing seems to have gone wrong so far, it's just old DB rows hanging around that shouldn't be, and confusing code.

To fix this in future, we should move to relying on an event that actually happens, like Crowd's {{UserDeletedEvent}}. We also may or may not want to do a migration task to fix the broken data.
fields.summary: User deletion cleanup tasks never being called

fields.description:
This bug was discovered while debugging a support case for Jira Service Desk.

h4. Steps to reproduce:
# Navigate to general configuration - {{/wiki/admin/viewgeneralconfig.action}}
# Save the value "UTF-16" where the value "UTF-8" is

h4. Expected behaviour:
Setting is saved successfully or a validation error is shown. 

h4. Actual behaviour:
Any location under /wiki seems to be broken, e.g. white page, JS errors, etc.
I couldn't find a way to recover the instance so that Confluence is accessible again

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Extra notes
* instances where it happened were
** https://sd-fluxxie.jira-dev.com/wiki (team dev instance, would like to find a way to recover it)
** https://ccapiaux-confluence-20182301.atlassian.net/wiki (wac trial instance)
* Saving with "UTF-8" (no change) worked before I tried with a different value (UTF-16), haven't tried with other values
fields.summary: Encoding setting can break the whole Confluence app

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Excerpting content from Blogposts using Blogposts Macro is retrieving content outside the Excerpt Macro

h3. Description
You may set a *Blogposts Macro* in order to retrieve content from blogposts within the same space. 
In the Macro panel you can set it to fetch different levels of data - you may set it to get only the blogposts title, only what's inside the excerpt macro, or all the content at the blogpost.
If you choose the second option - to show only what's inside the excerpt macro - it actually shows all the content of the page (if it fits the page - otherwise it'll only show part of the content, going past the excerpt macro and breaking the content with a "..." at the end.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a Space with blogposts, create a page
# Add a Blogposts macro to this page
# Select the *Excerpt* option inside the macro configuration panel
# Preview or Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The macro should fetch the blogpost title and only the pieces of content that are inside the Excerpt macro.

h3. Actual Results
The macro fetches all data in the page - even what's outside the Excerpt -, breaking the content around the 500th character, adding an "..." at the end of it.
fields.summary: Excerpting content from Blogposts using Blogposts Macro is retrieving content outside the Excerpt Macro

fields.description:
It would be good if the blueprint also allow customer to create  a "title" space with pages for each project, with child pages for additional information. Rather then make a Space for each project, instead of a page. 

The process of creating different space for each project could be tedious and time consuming. This ability is able to helps our customer to fasten their operation of documenting their project as well.
fields.summary: Ability to create pages for each project in the same space in Software Project Space blueprint

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When connecting a Confluence instance to a non-system Jira application for linking, Team Calendars will not be able to generate Jira events. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install [Team Calendars for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.extra.team-calendars/cloud/overview]
# Make sure to set up two application under different domains (e.g. Confluence: https://confluence.atlassian.net / Jira: https://jira.atlassian.net)
# After that, [link both apllications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/using-applinks-to-link-to-other-applications-779295829.html] through the *Application Links* menu, that will be under the Jira Administration/Confluence Settings.
# Once the applications are correctly linked and working, either create a new page (to insert the calendar) or go directly to the *Team Calendars* session of Confluence from the sidebar
# Once a new calendar is created, click on any date for the Calendar and *Add a new event*.
# Select an event from Jira (For example, the Jira Issue Dates)

h3. Expected Results
The event should load the following "Display" parameters in order to link to a currently existing Jira content (in the example, we can see Confluence linked to a *system application*, which is bundled in the same domain:
!event.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
An error message is displayed with {{Error(s) occurred.}}
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at the moment unless the user has a System application linked to display the information.
fields.summary: Jira Events (from a non-system Application Link) not Working for Team Calendars

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Google is not properly indexing the public page content of Confluence. Some are indexed but shows javascript error or "No information is available for this page"

h3. Environment
Confluence 1000.0.0-5db2cbbfc9d

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable Anonymous Access in Global Permission
# Grant public access to a space

h3. Expected Results
* Public Confluence pages should be indexed by Google with proper content

h3. Actual Results
* Some pages are indexed and some are not, some indexed pages shows javascript error or "No information is available for this page"
fields.summary: Public Confluence pages are not properly indexed by Google

fields.description:
Now, when the user (in this case a space-admin) restrict a Team Calendar but doesn't include himself, he won't be able to edit the restrictions for that calendar anymore.
h5. Suggestion 

Allow space-admins to be able to edit Team Calendar restrictions.
fields.summary: Allow space admins to edit calendar's restrictions

fields.description:
Using Safari Version 11.0.2. To reproduce:
 # Create a line of bolded or italicised text
 # Press return to create a new line underneath the above text
 # Add a bulleted or numbered list

*Expected*

The list is created. The cursor is on the list line to allow for text entry.

*Actual*

The list is created. The cursor jumps to a new line and cannot be moved back to to the list. The list line remains empty. Toggling bold / italics off will force the cursor back to the expected location.

*Workaround*

Create the list with no text formatting. Add bold or italics after the list has been created.
fields.summary: Creating lists in Safari under bolded or italicised text forces the cursor to a new line

fields.description:
h2. Summary
"Sort by" function in "Page Properties Report" macro not working when key/value pair missing in one of the source pages which are being pulled into the macro.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create *Page A* with page properties macro with below key/value pairs.
{quote}
|Target Date|09 Jan 2019|
|Team|Lions|
|Status|Triage|
|_id_|_900_|
{quote}
# Add label "test_lable" to *Page B* 
# Create *Page A* with page properties macro with below key/value pairs.
{quote}
|Target Date|09 Aug 2018|
|Team|Tigers|
|Status|In Progress|
{quote}
# Add label "test_lable" to *Page B* 
# # Create *Page C* with page properties macro with below key/value pairs.
{quote}
|Target Date|09 Nov 2018|
|Team|Deers|
|Status|QA|
|_id_|_250_|
{quote}
# Add label "test_lable" to *Page C* 
# Now, create a new page *Main Page*  and insert _Page Properties Report_ macro. Configure the macro to pull the pages with label "test_lable" and add columns Target Date, Team, Status and id to show in the page and sort the content by "id" column.

h3. Expected result
_Page Properties Report_ macro in *Main Page* should sort the content and display as below.
||Title||Target Date||Team||Status||id||
|Page C|09 Nov 2018|Deers|QA|_250_|
|Page A|09 Jan 2019|Lions|Triage|_900_|
|Page B|09 Aug 2018|Tigers|In Progress| |

h3. Actual result
Content doesn't sort as expected.

h3. Notes: 
It's also observed that if the key/value pair font format is not same across all the pages, sort may not work as expected.

h3. Workaround
Add key/value pair which is being used for sorting across all the pages so that sorting works as expected. (This does not work)
fields.summary: "Sort by" function in "Page Properties Report" macro not working when key/value pair missing in one of the pages

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Cannot save or publish pages 
h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Edit a page
 # Try to Save it/Publish it
 # Notice that an error message is displayed: "There was an error processing the request."  

h3. *Expected Results*

The page should be successfully saved/published

h3. *Actual Results*

An error message is displayed and users cannot save/publish the page
h3. *Notes*

This issue was noticed to be reproducible only for imported pages.
h3. *Developer tools logs:*
{code:java}
jquery-min.js:3 PUT https://mysignintern.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/56328193?status=draft 501 ()

 {code}

fields.description: h3. Summary When creating a new blank space in Confluence Cloud the raw HTML markup tags are shown in the Overview page. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a new Confluence space # Overview page loads with raw HTML markup h3. Expected Results * The following text is shown with the correct markup: *Edit this home page* - Click _Edit_ in the top right of this screen to customize your Space home page *Create your first page* - Click the Create button in the header to get started *Brand your Space*- Click Configure Sidebar in the left panel to update space details and logo *Set permissions* - Click Space Tools in the left sidebar to update permissions and give others access !2018-01-22_17-29-30.png|width=1028,height=374! h3. Actual Results * The text shows the HTML tags instead: Edit this home page - Click Edit in the top right of this screen to customize your Space home page Create your first page - Click the Create button in the header to get started Brand your Space - Click Configure Sidebar in the left panel to update space details and logo Set permissions - Click Space Tools in the left sidebar to update permissions and give others access !2018-01-22_17-28-56.png|width=1029,height=376! h3. Workaround Edit the Default Space Content Template with the correct markup: # Go to Confluence Administration page and select Global Templates and Blueprints. # Click edit next to the Default Space Content Template. # Remove the and tags and use the inbuilt editor to format the text. # Click save.
fields.summary: Raw HTML markup in overview page when creating a new space

fields.description:
h3. Summary

A Roadmap Planner macro in an Excerpt macro will not render if being displayed via an Excerpt-Include macro. Furthermore, the Macro shows an error indicating to view the macro in the app. Clicking on the error as instructed directs you to install the application.


h3. Environment
* IOS Mobile App
* Android Mobile App

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1) Create a page with a Roadmap Planner macro in an excerpt macro.
2)  Create another page with an Excerpt-Include macro that includes the excerpt from the previous step.
3) View the second page which contains the Excerpt-Include macro in the Confluence Mobile app. 
- take note of the result
4) tap the error as instructed

h3. Expected Results
- The Roadmap Planner Macro is rendered without error.

h3. Actual Results
=== Example Source page ===
 !Test For JIRA Gadgets.jpg|thumbnail! 
===
Note that the source page will render the Roadmap Planner without issues.

=== Example Result ===
 !Excerpt include result.jpg|thumbnail! 
===
 - The gadget is not rendered, and you are directed to install the app (which you are using).

=== Follow Link Result ===
 !Follow link result.jpg|thumbnail! 
===
You are directed to the application install page, and possibly to the app store in spite of the application already being installed.

h3. Notes
Confirmed for both IOS and Android.

h3.Workaround
Us the browser instead of the Confluence App.
fields.summary: Roadmap Planner macro nested in Excerpt Include macro does not render in Mobile App

fields.description:
In some cases, the number of event types in Team calendars can become quite long causing the page to be longer than is needed and negatively impacts the readability of the page.

To mitigate this without having to remove the utility of having a legend,  I propose the addition of a collapsible and/or scrollable legend for the Team Calendars Macro.

This would drastically improve the usability of pages with this macro for mobile and desktop consumers alike.
fields.summary: Make option for collapsable legend in Team Calendars Macro

fields.description:
h3. Problem
- We are not able to export versions of a page on Confluence. Even if we export a custom xml or pdf, we cannot get the page versions.

h3. Suggestion
- Allow to export versions of pages on Confluence.

h3. Workaround
- None
fields.summary: Export versions of a page on Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When the Code Block macro is inside a Section macro, the highlighting (selection) is lost when the mouse goes outside the Code Block macro square. 

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Open a page on Edit mode on Confluence.
* Add a Section macro.
* Inside the Section macro, add a Code Block macro.
* Add code inside the Code Block macro. 
* Drag to highlight the code inside the Code Block macro.
* Keep dragging the mouse outside the area of the Code block macro.


h3. Expected Results
* Items outside de Code block macro are highlighted.

h3. Actual Results
* The highlighting (selection) is lost.


h3.Workaround
* Keep the Code Block macro outside the a Section macro. 






Examples:  [^InsideSectionMacro.mov]  [^OutsideSectionMacro.mov]
fields.summary: Code block macro highlighting (selection) lost when inside Section macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Not possible to drag to highlight content inside a Section macro when there is a table. Trying to highlight it makes the highlight disappear.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Open a page on Edit mode on Confluence.
* Add a Section macro.
* Inside the Section macro, add some text and create a table.
* Start to drag to highlight the text and the table.


h3. Expected Results
* The text and the table are highlighted.

h3. Actual Results
* As soon as the highlight reaches the table, the screen either flashes and the highlight goes away OR the highlight just goes away. 


h3.Workaround
* Copy the content and paste it outside the Section macro. It makes it possible to highlight all the content. 



Similar to: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-26442
fields.summary: Can't drag to highlight content with tables inside Section macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When users without permission to edit comments get to a page with comments, they are able to see the option to edit, click on it and edit it. They can't save the content.

If they are not able to edit comments, they should not be able to see this option or at least see a warning notifying this lack of permission, which doesn't happens since the application do not shows any warnings.

On the documentation says they need Add Comment permission and says that admins on the space can edit comments, but doesn't clarify if is mandatory to be an admin in order to edit comments.

h3. Environment
(!) Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Get to a page with a user without permission to edit comments
# You will be able to edit the comment
# When saving the page will be loading forever with a spinning animation.

h3. Expected Results
User should not be able to see the option to edit it, or, a warning regarding which permission is necessary to edit comments.

h3. Actual Results
The page just keeps loading and nothing happens.
 
h3.Workaround
Place the JIRA Issue macro outside the expand macro.
fields.summary: Customers without permission can edit comments
Customers without permission can edit comments

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the share button to share with a group, the resulting email will have a textual description in the email like:
{username) *shared* {pagename} with {groupname}

But the groupname will be the name of a seemingly random group, rather than the name of the group that was actually targeted by the share.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Ensure you have access to at least a couple of user email inboxes so that you can view the results.
# Make sure your instance has a few groups that you can select from and that have different users in them.
# go to any page and click the share button
# Add any one group to share the page with
# go to the inbox of a user you expect to get the notification.

h3. Expected Results
The email indicates the correct information on who the email was sent to.

h3. Actual Results
Here is an example of the test that I ran:
=== Example Test ===
 !Example Test.png|thumbnail! 
===

And here was my result:
=== Example Result ===
 !Example Result.png|thumbnail! 
===

As you can see, the top section shows that the email was sent to the "confluence-users" group, even though that group was never added to the share.
 

h3.Workaround
There is currently no workaround for this.
fields.summary: Sharing a page with a group will provide the wrong group in the email description text

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using Table of Contents and a Children Display Macro as a heading, the descendants, if selected, appear as a single line.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page and a few children pages.
# Insert the Table of Contents Macro into the parent page.
# Insert heading style, and include Children Display macro in this heading.
# In Children Display macro, click *Show Descendants* 
# Save the page

h3. Expected Results
It's expected that each descendant, which has its own bullet point, should show in the table of contents as separate lines.

h3. Actual Results
They appear in TOC as a single line:
 !Screen Shot 2018-01-19 at 3.30.07 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3.Workaround
No current workaround.
fields.summary: Children Display macro descendants appear as single line in Table of Contents Macro

fields.description: Removing the "reCaptcha" for Chinese IPs would allow users to access the product without the need to use a VPN to complete the sign-up or log-in process.
fields.summary: Remove the "reCaptcha" for Chinese IPs

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
 * If we try to add any effect on a page in Confluence, the page freeze and there is an infinite spinner when trying to add an effect in the editor.
 * Old images with effects applied to them are not visible.

 

*Steps to Reproduce*
h3. *For New images*
 # Edit a new Confluence page
 # Insert a new attachment (a picture, in this case)
 # Add the requested effect by clicking on the image > Properties > Effects
 # Notice that there is a never-ending spinning wheel and you cannot do anything on that page
 # Refresh the page and notice that the picture was not added

h3. *For Old images*
 # Edit a Confluence page with images
 # Notice that the image which have effects applied are not displayed

h3. *Expected Results*
 # Effects should be successfully added and reflected on images
 # Old images with effects applied to them should be displayed

h3. *Actual Results*
 # If you add an effect to an image, the page freeze and there is an infinite spinner when trying to add an effect in the editor.
 # Images with effects applied are not displayed

h3. *Note*
h3. *Workaround*
 * For new images, there is no known workaround, we kindly ask users to not use effects until a permanent solution will be applied
 * For old images, customers can edit the image and remove the filter, or if they have multiple images and this is not feasible, please submit a ticket to support team, and one support engineer can delete all effects directly on the database.
fields.summary: Adding effects to new images freezes Confluence and old images with effects are not displayed

- When we place images on Confluence, we are able to configure the pixels on it, but not the height and width of the images, making it impossible to resize images to a specific size.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Using the up arrow to navigate the lines of text inside a panel macro causes the cursor to jump out and above the panel, regardless of where the cursor is in any arbitrary number of lines. 
The same effect also occurs with the down arrow key.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page;
# Insert a panel macro;
# Insert some text inside the panel with multiple rows;
# Press the up or down key to navigate between the text lines

h3. Expected Results
The Cursor moves up/down one line of text

h3. Actual Results
The Cursor "Jumps" outside the panel. 

h3.Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: Using Up and Down arrow keys to navigate text inside a panel macro jumps the cursor out of the panel.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Sometimes the font type selector won't change the font on the Android app editor

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud
* Android Confluence Cloud app (tested on v1.14.10)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page;
# Write a Heading 1 text;
# Write a paragraph below it;
# Try to make another level 1 heading below that paragraph.

h3. Expected Results
It should create another Heading 1 text below the paragraph.

h3. Actual Results
Clicking on the Heading 1 selector doesn't change the font type.

h3.Workaround
Make a bulleted list after the paragraph.
Make another level 1 heading under the bulleted list.
fields.summary: Editor on Android mobile app won't change font type

fields.description:
h3. Summary
- Customer is getting the following error on filter results gadget on confluence pages in edit mode:
{code}filter-results-gadget.xml was not added to this confluence instance yet{code}

- On view mode this message can be seen:
{code}This gadget cannot be displayed on your dashboard. This could be due to a licensing problem or an application error. If you need this gadget, contact your administrator for assistance. Otherwise, you can remove it from your dashboard.{code}

- It happens only with old macros already placed, new macros are working fine.
- Taking a look at the storage format of the page, I can see that old macros are using http, while new macros are using https protocol.

h3. Environment
(!) Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access a page where we can find an old Filter results gadget macro
# Try to edit the page

h3. Expected Results
Filter Results macro should be displayed and editable

h3. Actual Results
- On view mode this message can be seen:
{code}This gadget cannot be displayed on your dashboard. This could be due to a licensing problem or an application error. If you need this gadget, contact your administrator for assistance. Otherwise, you can remove it from your dashboard.{code}

- On edit mode this Red Error can be seen:
{code}Filter-results-gadget.xml was not added to this confluence instance yet{code}
 
h3.Workaround
Set the http and https url's on the external gadgets of the Cloud instance, only for Cloud Support Team members.
fields.summary: Filter-results-gadget.xml was not added to this confluence instance yet

fields.description:
Currently migration from Cloud to Server is not supported for Confluence Question based on a previous [decision|https://pug.jira-dev.com/wiki/spaces/CQ/pages/2960457782/DACI+How+Does+Connect+CQ+Support+Import+and+Export].

However, this does not communicated anywhere publicly, and this is misleading to Users and Supporters alike.

It'll be great if we add this decision and provide warning in the following page:
[Migrate from Confluence Cloud to Server - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/migrate-from-confluence-cloud-to-server-724765578.html]
fields.summary: Add information in the Migrate from Confluence Cloud to Server

fields.description:
h3. Problem

For users of the Confluence SOAP API, the CreateUser request is failing after 7 - 8 seconds due to a connection timeout. While the Confluence SOAP API has been deprecated for some time, there is currently no alternative API that provisions the creation of users.
h3. Suggested solution

Increase the connection timeout limit to prevent the failures.
fields.summary: Create user requests are failing for users of the Confluence SOAP API

fields.description:
We are receiving reports from users that our add-on macro is not being saved in Confluence cloud. We use a custom macro editor that saves a macro using AP.confluence.saveMacro(). 
I can personally reproduce the following scenario for our Gliffy macros:

- create a new macro
- close the macro editor without saving
- create a new macro using the dropdown - insert option (not by typing {name).
- save the macro 
- save the page
- macro does not get added to the page and is lost.

It looks like this is related to closed issue https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/CE-982, which was perhaps only partially fixed. Please investigate ASAP, as this is contributing to lost work for many of our customers

 

h3.Notes
Copied from [https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/CE-1152] for the team to triage.

The original video attachment can be downloaded [here|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/secure/attachment/100342/macro-lost.mov]
fields.summary: Macros are not being saved when macro editor closed

fields.description:
This is something we are experiencing when creating a dynamic macro in a confluence page.  Curious if this is something that affects third party connect add-ons in general.

- create a dynamic macro for a third party connect add and save it using AP.confluence.saveMacro()
- edit and save the macro again.
- an additional macro is created.  Expected result is that a single macro is updated.

This only happens if the macro is on a draft page.  Once the page is published it is no longer an issue.

h3.Notes
Copied from https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/CE-1145 for proper triaging of the team
fields.summary: Successive saves on a new dynamic macro creates multiple macros

fields.description:
# Summary

Using the up arrow to navigate the lines of text in the top row of a table causes the cursor to jump out and above the table, regardless of where the cursor is in any arbitrary number of lines. This happens in the row that is normally defaulted as the header, it also happens if the top row is de-designated as the header.

The same effect also occurs with the down arrow key when navigating text in the last/bottom row of a table. It will jump out of the table just below the table, regardless of how many lines of text are in the cell.

This issue also occurs with the "info" macro. Placing the cursor at any point in a multi-line text in an info box then using either the up or down arrow keys will "jump" the cursor outside of the info box.

This issue also occurs for the "code block" macro. Placing the cursor at any point in a multi-line text in a code Block macro and hitting the "up" or "down" arrow keys will "jump" the cursor outside of the code block macro.

This issue also occurs for any text inside a "column" macro. If the Column macro is nested inside a "section" macro, and the section has text just above or below the "column macro", the jump will skip all the way outside of the "Section" macro instead of just the "column" macro.
h3. Environment

Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce

=== Table Top Row ===
 # create a table on any page
 # in the header row, in any cell
 # create multiple lines of text
 # Try to use the up arrow to go back up one line.

=== Table Bottom Row ===
 # Create a table on any page
 # In the Bottom row, create many lines of text.
 # move the cursor back up the lines of text
 # Use the down arrow to try and move down a line of text.

=== Info, Code block, and Column Macro ===
 # add one of any of these macros to a page
 # Place some multi-line text preferably with 5 or more lines.
 # move the cursor to any line in the macro in the editor
 # hit the up or down arrow key

h3. Expected Results

=== Table Top Row ===
The Cursor moves up one line of text

=== Bottom Row ===
The Cursor moves down one line of text

=== Info, Code block, and Column Macro ===
The Cursor moves to the line above or below inside the macro.
h3. Actual Results

=== Top Row ===
The Cursor "Jumps" outside and above the whole table.

=== Table Bottom Row ===
The Cursor "Jumps" outside and below the whole table.

=== Info, Code block, and Column Macro ===
The Cursor "Jumps" outside the macro, either above or below where the macro was.
h3. Workaround

It is possible to avoid this issue by having an empty row on the top and bottom of the table that avoids the bug. You can remove the extra rows when you are done editing.

You can also use shift + arrow keys in order to select the text line by line, then use a left/right arrow key to de-select the text and leave the cursor in the line that you want.
fields.summary: Using Up and Down arrow keys to navigate text in various contexts causes cursor to jump out of context

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The thumbnail of a image becomes broken when any filter is applied to the image.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a page;
# Attach any image file;
# Select the image and click on properties;
# Select any filter and click on Save.

h3. Expected Results
The filter is applied and the thumbnail will display correctly.

h3. Actual Results
The filter is not applied, the properties dialog won't go away and, if the page is reloaded and published, the image thumbnail will be broken.
 
h3.Workaround
Remove the filter from the image.
fields.summary: Broken thumbnail shown for images in a page
